StateMachine
Class LWRGravComp

java.lang.Object
  StateMachine.LWRGravComp
All Implemented Interfaces:
LWRState
public class LWRGravComp
extends java.lang.Object
implements LWRState

In This State the LWR is set to GravitationsCompensation mode so that robot can be moved without constraints. *

Version:
0.1
Author:
Sebastian Tauscher

public LWRGravComp()
Method Detail

CalcControlParam

public void CalcControlParam(LWRStatemachine lwrStatemachine)
In this Function control Mode Parameters are set and the commanded pose are calculated due the current LWR State. In the GravComp State the Translational and rotational Stiffness is set to zero and the command pose to the current measured Pose. Because the Values are static whiles this State is active the Values are just set when the InitFlag of the state machine is true.

Specified by:
CalcControlParam in interface LWRState
Parameters:
lwrStatemachine - - The operated state machine
See Also:
LWRState

SetACKPacket

public void SetACKPacket(LWRStatemachine lwrStatemachine)
In this Function the Acknowledge String which is send to the State Control is defined due the current LWR State. In the GravCompState the String is Set to "GravComp;".

Specified by:
SetACKPacket in interface LWRState
Parameters:
lwrStatemachine - The operated Statemachine
See Also:
LWRIdle, LWRGravComp, LWRRegistration, LWRSendData, LWRWaitforData, LWRVirtualFixtures, LWRPathImp, LWRMovetoPose

InterpretCMDPacket

public void InterpretCMDPacket(LWRStatemachine lwrStatemachine)
In this Function the Command String which is received from the State Control is interpreted and the parameters are set. It is just called after a State transition For the LWRState LWRGravComp this is empty because no Parameters are send from the state control.

Specified by:
InterpretCMDPacket in interface LWRState
Parameters:
lwrStatemachine - - The operated state machine
See Also:
LWRState
